channel.title: Removing admin crown/hidden admin
channel.description:
I want to create a hidden admin on my server but there is no built in rights for that. So i used the co-owner rights and just edited the text when you yell. But when talking you still have the admin crown. Where can i edit/remove that. OR does someone have code for a hidden admin?
And i don't know what server this is? 508-526? http://i.imgur.com/TWvwP.png
thanks for your time

item.title: Removing admin crown/hidden admin
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

Then Fridder it may just be a case of the server not sending the correct crown id’s no? In which case this would be server sided and it does belong here.

Kid, I told you where the crowns were being sent in a standard winterLove. If you are incapable of changing them, I suggest you go learn some basic java so you can start to understand the structure of the server and how it works. Saying “anyone else” implies you just want this answer to be spoonfed to you. We are not a spoon feeding community. Plus we can’t just give you the answers as we do not know the ID’s within your client

Read full topic

item.title: Removing admin crown/hidden admin
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Christmas_tree, post:8, topic:478383”]No. The client meerly holds the images within the cache and sends the image according to the data sent by the server.

Server>client instructions are sent under initialize() (in standard wL). You change player rights server sided, and sent via frames the client configures what the server sends. It’s not some sort of runescape magic spell.[/quote]

I understand that.

Fridder:

The server doesn’t send the crown.

is correct, the server TELLS the client to send the crown. You misinterpreted what I said.

Christmas_tree:

You can edit the client directly to show different crowns, but it will only be for that client. If my friend had srcalldummiesremoved and I had an edited version of the same client but I made admin crowns show under the specific data sent by the server for any player rights to show the crown, it would only show on my client. Not my friends. You cannot directly manipulate the server code or player files (unless you intercept a connection and data mine).

Obviously, unless you give the client to your friends.

Read full topic

item.title: Removing admin crown/hidden admin
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

No. The client meerly holds the images within the cache and sends the image according to the data sent by the server.

Server>client instructions are sent under initialize() (in standard wL). You change player rights server sided, and sent via frames the client configures what the server sends. It’s not some sort of runescape magic spell.

You can edit the client directly to show different crowns, but it will only be for that client. If my friend had srcalldummiesremoved and I had an edited version of the same client but I made admin crowns show under the specific data sent by the server for any player rights to show the crown, it would only show on my client. Not my friends. You cannot directly manipulate the server code or player files (unless you intercept a connection and data mine).

Read full topic

item.title: Removing admin crown/hidden admin
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Christmas_tree, post:5, topic:478383”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=596577.msg4201169#msg4201169 date=1358216307]
Change the player rights to 5. If there’s still a crown, keep going until there’s no crown, but don’t bother if there’s still a crown at 7.

Also this belongs here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,138.0.html
[/quote]

Not if you are changing how the player rights assigns the crowns server side.[/quote]

The server doesn’t send the crown. The crowns are done/sent client-sided. On the client, the crown is virtually just an image. The client can be manipulated to show an administrator crown on a regular player (client-sided), but you’re not an administrator server-sided.

Read full topic

item.title: Removing admin crown/hidden admin
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

This is client sided and that’s a 317, not 508. Search for myPrivileges in client.java.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:4, topic:478383”]Change the player rights to 5. If there’s still a crown, keep going until there’s no crown, but don’t bother if there’s still a crown at 7.

Also this belongs here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,138.0.html[/quote]

Not if you are changing how the player rights assigns the crowns server side.

Read full topic

item.title: Removing admin crown/hidden admin
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Change the player rights to 5. If there’s still a crown, keep going until there’s no crown, but don’t bother if there’s still a crown at 7.

Also this belongs here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,138.0.html

item.title: Removing admin crown/hidden admin
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

Under your initialize() method, for each individual player rights case a crown is set. You can alter the code to send crowns as you wish.

Read full topic
